column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
column14: Love Nude Lust! My favorite nude from a department store brand got discontinued and ever since I’ve been hopelessly searching for my everyday lipstick. The pigmentation isn’t the same but that’s to be expected for maybelline. Seems to be moisturizing enough. Who cares if you have to reapply if the price is so low? (Pic is with clear gloss on top)

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2016
column14: Been ordering this prodcut for over a year - really like the color. Doesn't go on as thick and creamy as I'd like but the color is great - perfect neutral for many different looks.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2021
column14: I was expecting this to be a cream finish, but it definitely has a frost to it. It looks darker in the tube, but because of the frost, it is a good shade or two lighter on the lips. I actually really enjoy this. It's very comfortable to wear. It is not a smelly lipstick. (I've had some strong chemical/plastic smelling ones in the past.) I was looking for a "nude" color and this one works for lighter skin. Would recommend!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019
column14: I bought the shade ‘Crazy for Coffee’, I was looking for a nude-ish color with a slight pop of red. My skin tone is Asian-Indian/medium/tan/olive and this shade does a good job,

column6: Rum Riche is one of the better Maybelline bullets lipsticks
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2018
column14: I have never had a good experience with Maybelline bullet lipsticks, because they're all too sheer and slippery-----but Rum Riche is much better than the other shades I've tried in the past few weeks (e.g. Siren in Scarlet, Infra Red, Vibrant Violet) due to the opacity and the ability to stay where you put it without sliding off your face.

column6: Slightly darker than a classic old Hollywood red, very pretty
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2016
column14: This is another great red lipstick that I have purchased lately that I am very pleased with.  I have blue eyes, blonde hair, and a light/medium skin tone, and this shade is a great match for my coloring.  It is just a tad darker than a true, Hollywood type red.  It is not a wine color, or a fire engine red with orange tones - it is just a classic, bright red.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018
column14: This product's color is misleading. The darker edges of the lipstick case is what I hoped to find, but the center color of the lipstick case is what you will find, if you purchase the "red rival" lipstick . I wish the sellers would use something like a color wheel, if they want to gain the buyer's trust when making a future purchase. Don't just do a copy and paste of any red or whatever shade you're selling. You might as well not have a photo at all. How hard is it to smear the color on a white sheet of paper, shine a bright light on it and take a stinkin pic of it. Wow.

column6: “Satin” meaning sparkly... not “in between matte and glossy”
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2018
column14: Well this was sufficiently hideous. I thought that “satin” meant it just wasn’t matte and wasn’t glossy-  but it has a weird old-lady sparkly finish.
